intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. chamaexiphus, commonly known as the dwarf bean or shrub bean, is a variety of the common bean plant. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds, similar to other beans in the Phaseolus genus. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for container gardening and small spaces. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring moderate water and care.
